replication_study.hypothesis: For U.S. state–year observations, the (log) average weekly working hours per worker is positively associated with (log) carbon-dioxide emissions, controlling for political, economic, and demographic covariates.

data_plan.source_type: Public secondary data merged from U.S. EIA, BLS CES, BEA, and supplemental demographic sources

qualification.explanation: Dataset reconstructs the same variables used by Fitzgerald (2018) but adds three additional post-period years, allowing an independent test of robustness on fresh data while preserving identical measurement strategy.
qualification.similarity_to_original: Uses identical variable definitions: wrkhrs, CO₂ (epa), GDP, population, etc. as demonstrated in original R script (Fitzgerald 2018 Script_clean v2.R) and described in post_registration.json.
qualification.deviation_from_original: Original study covered 2007–2013 (post_registration.json → data.wave_or_subset). Current dataset includes 2014–2016 (see compiled.dta year variable; get_dataset_shape and head). Thus it constitutes a new temporal sample.

data_plan.notes: Year variable is numeric 7–16 representing 2007–2016. Continuous variables enter logged form; script handles log(0) by prior inspection—no zeros observed in required vars.

planned_method.steps: 1. Load compiled, hhsize, and epa Stata files. 2. Reshape hhsize from wide to long. 3. Merge into master panel. 4. Compute employed-population %, manufacturing-GDP %, and log-transform requisite variables. 5. Drop rows with missing data. 6. Estimate entity- and time-fixed-effects model with clustered standard errors. 7. Extract coefficient on wrkhrs and compare to original 0.668 elasticity.
planned_method.models: Fixed-effects (within) linear panel regression with entity and time dummies; cluster-robust SEs at state level (PanelOLS, cov_type="clustered").
planned_method.outcome_variable: epa (log of state CO₂ emissions index)
planned_method.independent_variables: wrkhrs (log average weekly working hours) – focal; plus log emppop_pct, laborprod, pop, manu_gdp, energy, hhsize, workpop.
planned_method.control_variables: State fixed effects, year fixed effects, and logged covariates listed above.
planned_method.tools_software: Python 3.10, pandas, numpy, statsmodels, linearmodels, pyreadstat

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Coefficient (elasticity) of wrkhrs in the fixed-effects model
planned_estimation_and_test.test: t-test on wrkhrs coefficient using clustered SEs (H0: β_wrkhrs ≤ 0 ; H1: β_wrkhrs > 0)

planned_method.inference_criteria: Reject H0 if p < 0.05 (one-tailed) and coefficient sign is positive.

files.replication_data/replicate_fitzgerald201: Loads data, creates derived variables, performs fixed-effects regression with clustered SEs, prints full summary and focal wrkhrs elasticity.

codebase.notes: Script is self-contained; all file paths use /app/data. Requires linearmodels and pyreadstat for panel regression and Stata file I/O.

analysis.instructions: Run `python replication_data/replicate_fitzgerald2018.py` inside the container. Inspect the printed coefficient for wrkhrs and its p-value.
analysis.comparison_metrics: Compare sign (+), statistical significance (p < 0.05), and magnitude vs original elasticity 0.668. Robust replication if coefficient remains positive and statistically significant within ±0.15 margin.
